meanings.definition: The process of a liquid turning into vapor due to heating.
meanings.sent1: During the boiloff, the water in the pot changed into steam.
meanings.sent2: The boiloff of the water created a cloud of steam above the pot.
meanings.sent3: The boiloff of the soup made the kitchen feel like a sauna.
meanings.sent4: The boiloff of the liquid was like watching magic as it disappeared into thin air.
meanings.sent5: The sudden boiloff of the liquid startled everyone in the room.

meanings.definition: The amount of liquid that evaporates during boiling.
meanings.sent1: The chef measured the boiloff to determine how much water had evaporated.
meanings.sent2: The boiloff from the pot left a residue of salt on the surface.
meanings.sent3: The boiloff of the milk left a creamy film on the sides of the pan.
meanings.sent4: The boiloff of the liquid was so rapid that the pot seemed to empty in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The boiloff of the liquid filled the kitchen with a warm, humid air.

meanings.definition: To cause a liquid to evaporate by heating.
meanings.sent1: She had to boiloff the excess water to thicken the sauce.
meanings.sent2: The chef instructed to boiloff the broth until it reduced by half.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally left the pot unattended, causing a boiloff of the soup.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat helped to boiloff the liquid quickly.
meanings.sent5: The simmering helped to gradually boiloff the excess liquid from the stew.
